page.title: 19Special Features (2)
page.content:
In Shelford, there is the head office of{Torch Computers Ltd}who make a business-standard cmputer add-on for the BBC machine. Their units are mainly Z80-based and run CP/M software.
They also manufacture larger units with hard disks, again for business use. Their products are designed for modern communications use, and offer many computer languages such as Fortran, Pascal, Cobol, and BCPL.
Further along the road, a footpath to{Nine Wells}leads to a small plantation round{springs}which supply the famous Hobson's Conduit which provided Cambridge University with water, and still runs through one of Cambridge main streets.
